intro: Armeniastrum apiculatum, commonly known as the Sierra foothill buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, three-lobed fruits. Armeniastrum apiculatum is adapted to arid environments and is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
